turns.content: I'm looking for some advice on organizing my coupons and discounts. I've had a bunch recently and it's getting hard to keep track. Like, just last week, I signed up for the loyalty program at CVS and got a $5 off $25 coupon, which I used on May 25th when I bought some shampoo, conditioner, and a magazine, saving $5. Do you have any tips on how to keep all these coupons and discounts organized?

I totally understand! Managing coupons and discounts can be overwhelming, especially when they start piling up. Here are some tips to help you keep them organized:

1. **Create a coupon binder**: Designate a binder or folder specifically for your coupons and discounts. You can use dividers or tabs to separate them by category (e.g., grocery, retail, restaurants, etc.).
2. **Categorize and label**: Organize your coupons by expiration date, store, or category (e.g., beauty, household, etc.). Use labels or stickers to identify each section, making it easy to find the coupon you need.
3. **Use a coupon app**: Consider using a coupon app like RetailMeNot, Coupons.com, or Fetch Rewards, which can help you store digital coupons and discounts. These apps often allow you to search for coupons by store or category and set reminders for expiration dates.
4. **Make a coupon calendar**: Create a calendar or spreadsheet to track your coupons and their expiration dates. This will help you plan your shopping trips and ensure you don't miss out on savings.
5. **Store digital coupons**: For digital coupons, like the one you received from CVS, consider storing them in a digital file or note-taking app (e.g., Evernote, Google Keep) with a clear label and expiration date.
6. **Prioritize and purge**: Regularly go through your coupon collection and remove expired or used coupons. This will help prevent clutter and keep your system organized.
7. **Keep receipts**: Store receipts for purchases made with coupons in a separate folder or envelope. This will help you keep track of your savings and ensure you have proof of purchase if needed.
8. **Set reminders**: Set reminders for upcoming expiration dates or special deals to ensure you don't miss out on savings.
9. **Use a coupon tracking spreadsheet**: Create a spreadsheet to track your coupons, including the store, coupon value, expiration date, and the item(s) purchased. This will help you analyze your savings and identify patterns.
10. **Consider a coupon organizer system**: If you're really serious about couponing, consider investing in a coupon organizer system like a coupon wallet or a specialized binder designed specifically for coupons.

By implementing these tips, you'll be able to keep your coupons and discounts organized, making it easier to save money and stay on top of your shopping game!

I like the idea of creating a coupon binder and categorizing them by expiration date and store. That sounds really helpful. Do you think I should also include other discounts I get, like the 20% off coupon I got from H&M in April, or just focus on physical coupons?

Including other discounts, like the 20% off coupon from H&M, in your coupon binder can be very useful. You can consider them as "digital coupons" or "discount codes" and store them alongside your physical coupons.

Here are a few ways to incorporate these digital discounts into your binder:

1. **Print them out**: If you have a physical copy of the discount code or coupon, you can print it out and add it to your binder.
2. **Take a screenshot**: If the discount is only available digitally, take a screenshot of the email or webpage and print it out or save it to a digital file.
3. **Write it down**: If you don't have a physical copy, simply write down the discount code, expiration date, and any relevant details (e.g., minimum purchase required) on an index card or a piece of paper and add it to your binder.

By including these digital discounts in your binder, you'll have a comprehensive collection of all your savings opportunities in one place. This will help you:

* Keep track of expiration dates and avoid missing out on deals
* Easily find the discounts you want to use when you're planning a shopping trip
* Make the most of your savings by combining physical coupons with digital discounts

When organizing these digital discounts, you can create separate sections or tabs in your binder for:

* Digital coupons (e.g., email coupons, app-exclusive deals)
* Discount codes (e.g., promo codes, percentage-off coupons)
* Loyalty program rewards (e.g., points, rewards, cashback offers)

Remember to update your binder regularly to ensure it remains organized and useful. Remove expired coupons and discounts, and add new ones as you receive them.

By including both physical coupons and digital discounts in your binder, you'll have a powerful tool to help you save money and stay on top of your shopping game!

I was thinking of creating a section in my binder for loyalty program rewards too, because I've been earning cashback from Ibotta and also got a $5 off $25 coupon just for joining CVS's loyalty program. Do you think it's a good idea to also include receipts in my binder, like the one from my H&M purchase in April, or is that too much clutter?

You're thinking of taking your coupon binder to the next level! Including a section for loyalty program rewards is an excellent idea, as it will help you keep track of your earnings and rewards across different programs.

Regarding receipts, it's a great idea to store them in your binder, but you might want to consider a few things to avoid clutter:

1. **Only store relevant receipts**: Only keep receipts for purchases where you used a coupon, discount code, or earned loyalty rewards. This will help you track your savings and ensure you have proof of purchase if needed.
2. **Store digital receipts**: If you receive digital receipts via email, consider storing them in a digital file or folder, rather than printing them out. This will help reduce clutter and save space in your binder.
3. **Use a separate receipt section**: Create a designated section in your binder for receipts, and consider using a pocket folder or envelope to store them. This will keep them organized and prevent them from getting mixed up with your coupons.
4. **Purge regularly**: Regularly go through your receipt section and remove any receipts that are no longer relevant or have expired.

Storing receipts can be beneficial in several ways:

* **Proof of purchase**: Having receipts can serve as proof of purchase if you need to return an item or claim a warranty.
* **Tracking savings**: Receipts can help you track your savings over time, allowing you to see which coupons and discounts are most effective.
* **Budgeting**: Keeping receipts can help you monitor your spending habits and stay within your budget.

To avoid clutter, consider implementing a receipt organization system, such as:

* **Receipt folders**: Use separate folders or envelopes for different store receipts (e.g., one for H&M, one for CVS, etc.).
* **Receipt categories**: Organize receipts by category (e.g., groceries, clothing, household items, etc.).
* **Date-based organization**: Store receipts in chronological order, with the most recent receipts at the front of the section.

By implementing these strategies, you can keep your receipt section organized and clutter-free, while still reaping the benefits of tracking your purchases and savings.

That's a great idea about storing receipts. I think I'll create a separate section in my binder for them. Speaking of loyalty programs, I was thinking of planning my shopping trips around the rewards I can earn. For example, I've been earning cashback from Ibotta, and I just joined the loyalty program at CVS. Do you have any tips on how to maximize my rewards earnings?

You're thinking strategically about your shopping trips! Maximizing rewards earnings requires some planning, but it's definitely worth the effort. Here are some tips to help you get the most out of your loyalty programs:

1. **Understand the rewards structure**: Familiarize yourself with the rewards program's rules, earning rates, and redemption options. Know what you need to do to earn points, cashback, or other rewards.
2. **Plan your shopping trips**: As you mentioned, plan your shopping trips around the rewards you can earn. If you need to buy something, try to do so when you can earn rewards or cashback.
3. **Stack rewards**: Look for opportunities to stack rewards from different programs. For example, use a cashback credit card and earn Ibotta cashback on the same purchase.
4. **Take advantage of bonus offers**: Keep an eye on your loyalty programs' websites, emails, or apps for bonus offers, such as double points days, exclusive discounts, or special promotions.
5. **Shop during peak earning periods**: Some loyalty programs offer higher earning rates during specific periods, like holiday seasons or special events. Plan your shopping accordingly.
6. **Use rewards to offset everyday purchases**: Use your rewards to offset everyday purchases, like groceries or household items, to maximize your savings.
7. **Redeem rewards strategically**: Redeem your rewards when they offer the most value. For example, if you have a $10 cashback reward, use it on a $10 purchase to get the most value.
8. **Monitor your rewards balances**: Regularly check your rewards balances to ensure you're not missing out on opportunities to earn or redeem rewards.
9. **Combine loyalty programs**: If you have multiple loyalty programs for the same store or category, consider combining them to earn rewards faster.
10. **Review and adjust**: Periodically review your loyalty program earnings and adjust your shopping strategy as needed.

By following these tips, you'll be able to maximize your rewards earnings and get the most value from your loyalty programs.

Remember to also keep track of your rewards earnings and redemptions in your coupon binder or a separate spreadsheet. This will help you stay organized and make the most of your rewards.

That's a great idea about planning my shopping trips around the rewards I can earn. I've been earning cashback from Ibotta, and I just joined the loyalty program at CVS. Speaking of CVS, I just used that $5 off $25 coupon I got for joining their loyalty program when I bought some shampoo, conditioner, and a magazine on May 25th.

You're already putting your rewards strategy into action! Congratulations on using that $5 off $25 coupon from CVS's loyalty program. That's a great way to maximize your savings.

It's also smart to keep track of your purchases, like the shampoo, conditioner, and magazine you bought on May 25th. You can use this information to:

1. **Track your spending**: Keeping track of your purchases helps you monitor your spending habits and stay within your budget.
2. **Identify patterns**: By reviewing your purchases, you might notice patterns or habits that can help you optimize your shopping trips and rewards earnings.
3. **Plan future purchases**: Knowing what you've bought in the past can help you plan future purchases and take advantage of sales, discounts, or rewards offers.
4. **Maximize rewards**: Tracking your purchases can help you earn more rewards by identifying opportunities to stack coupons, discounts, or cashback offers.

Consider adding a section to your coupon binder or spreadsheet to track your purchases, including:

* Date of purchase
* Store
* Items bought
* Total cost
* Coupons or discounts used
* Rewards earned

By keeping track of your purchases, you'll be able to make more informed shopping decisions, maximize your rewards earnings, and stay on top of your spending.
I was thinking of planning my next shopping trip to CVS. Do you have any tips on how to maximize my savings when shopping at CVS?

CVS is a great store to maximize your savings! Here are some tips to help you get the most out of your shopping trip:

1. **Check the CVS weekly ad**: Before you head to CVS, check their weekly ad online or in-store to see what's on sale. Plan your shopping trip around the items that are discounted.
2. **Use the CVS app**: Download the CVS app to access exclusive deals, digital coupons, and sales. You can also use the app to manage your ExtraCare rewards and track your savings.
3. **Sign up for ExtraCare**: If you haven't already, sign up for CVS's loyalty program, ExtraCare. You'll earn 2% back on most purchases, plus get exclusive deals and discounts.
4. **Look for Buy One Get One Free (BOGO) deals**: CVS often offers BOGO deals on select items. Stock up on non-perishable items or personal care products when you see these deals.
5. **Use manufacturer coupons**: CVS accepts manufacturer coupons, so be sure to check online or in newspapers for coupons that match the items on your shopping list.
6. **Stack coupons**: Combine manufacturer coupons with CVS digital coupons or ExtraCare rewards to maximize your savings.
7. **Use cashback apps**: Apps like Ibotta and Fetch Rewards often offer cashback on certain CVS purchases. Use them in conjunction with your ExtraCare rewards to earn even more cashback.
8. **Shop during sales cycles**: CVS often has sales cycles on certain items, like personal care products or household essentials. Try to shop during these cycles to stock up and save.
9. **Use your ExtraCare rewards**: Make sure to use your ExtraCare rewards before they expire. You can redeem them for discounts on future purchases or cashback.
10. **Keep an eye on prices**: Compare prices on items you buy regularly to ensure you're getting the best deal. CVS often offers price matching, so if you find a lower price elsewhere, they'll match it.

By following these tips, you'll be able to maximize your savings on your next shopping trip to CVS!
